intro: Markhamia paucifoliolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf markhamia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Markhamia paucifoliolata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
